content.description: Blood clots are formed by a positive feedback loop. Two pathways exist, the extrinsic and intrinsic pathways, which converge during clot formation. There are many clotting factors involved, most of which are proteins. Vitamin <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is required for the formation of the active form of several of the clotting factors, including Factor <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A simplified model of the blood clotting process is shown in Figure 1.
content.question: Figure 1. Simplified model of clotting cascade Warfarin is a drug used to treat certain blood clots. Warfarin blocks the formation of the active form of vitamin <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-dependent clotting factors. Based on the model, which of the following best predicts the effects of warfarin on a patient?

choices.label: Fibrinogen will form fibrin, but the clot will not form because Factor <math alttext="13" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XIII</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will not be synthesized.
The intrinsic pathway will take over because the clotting factors are part of that pathway.
Thrombin will be converted to prothrombin because Factor <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will reverse the reaction.
Factor <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will not be activated, which will prevent thrombin from forming.

content.answer: Factor <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will not be activated, which will prevent thrombin from forming.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
